Text:
Okay. According to the map from the traveler, the
village should be right around here...
Welcome to the Golden Village.
Uh...yeah. Thanks.

(Their first instinct is to welcome strangers instead
of snoop? I guess even this backwater village gets
its fair share of tourists.)

Let me guess, you came here because you heard about
the golden fruit.

Yes, I wanted to have a bite of it. You know, have
a piece of the pie as it were.

I'm sure you do, I'm sure. That fruit is the reason
we're all so wealthy here.

But I'm sorry, Miss. We've had some fruit theft
recently, so we don't allow tours of the golden
fruit orchards anymore.

Oh, that's too bad. Well, I can understand why people
would want to steal it.

But you still have a solid chance at having a bite.
It just so happens, we're having a festival tonight.

You'll be able to taste the golden fruit at the
banquet. I hope we'll see you there!

Ooh, what perfect timing. Yes, I'd love to go to your
night festival.
(Seriously, everything's just too convenient...)

Maybe I'll have a look around town during the day.
Don't worry, I promise I'll keep away from the golden
fruit orchards.

Okay...yeah, as long as you keep away from the
orchards, you should be fine. You could relax at
a tea house instead, you know?

If I get tired, I'll definitely do that. Well, see
you tonight.

(I need to familiarize myself with the village layout
by nightfall. I need to figure out my escape route...
A lot of hazards come with my job.)

(But yeah, something about this village definitely
stinks... Everyone seems wealthy, but there's
something off about them.)

(I'm not sure exactly what it is...but it's like they
misbuttoned their brains...)
Hahaha! Kay's waving to me! Hiii!

(The kids sure are lively around here. Do they like
playing in the river?)

No, wait, that's not playing...that's drowning. This
just might give me an edge.
I'm coming to save you!!!

Phew... You should be okay. You coughed up most of
the water.
Th-Thanks... I s-slipped in...

No worries. I was thinking of cooling off in the
river anyway.
Still... Thanks.

I'm just glad you're okay. I'll carry you home. Hey,
kid, can you tell me where his house is?
S-Sure. The way you get to Kay's house is...
Thank you so much for saving my son.
No problem, I just happened to be nearby.
You don't look like you're from this village.

I'm not. I'm just a traveler, here to check out the
golden fruit.
I see... The golden fruit...

Oh dear, what I'm about to say might sound strange,
especially after you just saved my son's life, but...
Would you please leave our village?
Huh?!
Dad?

You stay quiet. This is a conversation for grown-ups
only.
Grown-ups only, eh?

Yes. I have nothing against you, just please, leave
our village as quickly as you can. Especially before
night falls.

(He's not angry... It's just, I've never seen such
sober eyes before.)

(Does he mean it? Does he really want me to leave?
Is it so I won't snoop around? Or something else...?)

I guess I'm not welcome here. Well, you have a nice
day.

(There are several villagers outside their house.
Were they guarding us? Or were they listening
in on us?)

(From the smile on that kid's face, one thing became
clear to me: the source of this disharmony I feel here.)

(All the grown-ups here are wealthy...yet none of
them smile with sincerity. All their smiles are
surface-level...)

(There's a reason why they can't smile with
sincerity...and I think I might know what it is.
It probably has something to do with the
festival tonight.)

(I've made my preparations. All that remains is to
wait for the festival.)
